title: section 141 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992), hereby make the following
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Vehicle Registration and Taxation
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Vehicle Registration and Taxation 

(Amendment) Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited vehicle registration taxation (amendment) regulation 2025

title: section 141 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992), hereby make the following
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 July 2025.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on 1 July 2025.

title: section 141 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992), hereby make the following
heading: In these Regulations “Regulations of 1992” means the Vehicle
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations “Regulations of 1992” means the Vehicle 

Registration and Taxation Regulations 1992 (S.I. No. 318 of 1992).
text_norm: 3 regulation regulation 1992 mean vehicle registration taxation regulation 1992 (s.i no 318 1992)

title: section 141 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992), hereby make the following
heading: 4. The Regulations of 1992 are amended –
text_raw:
4. The Regulations of 1992 are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 4 – 

(i) 

by inserting the following after the definition of “competent 
person”: 

“ ‘CO2 emissions’ has the same meaning as it has in section 
130 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992);”, 

(ii) by inserting the following after the definition of “electronic 

format”: 

“ ‘eligible vehicle’ means a vehicle to which these 
Regulations apply and which emits no CO2 tailpipe 
emissions;”, 

(iii) by the deletion of the definition of “registration office”, 

(b) by deleting Regulation 5, 

(c) 

by inserting after Regulation 9(9) the following paragraph: 

“(10) Subject to paragraphs 12A, 16 and 17 of the First Schedule, 
an eligible vehicle may display a plate which contains a stripe 
which is green in colour.”, 

(d) by the substitution of the following for Regulation 11: 

“11. The Commissioners may require the owner of a vehicle to 
surrender to them a certificate issued in respect of the vehicle in 
any case where they have reason to believe that the certificate 
contains particulars which are not correct, and on being so 
required, the owner of the vehicle shall surrender the certificate 
to the Commissioners forthwith.”, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 24th June, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [268] 3 

(e) 

(f) 

in Regulation 12 by the substitution of “vehicle identification 
number and engine number” for “frame number and engine 
number, in the case of a motor-cycle, and the chassis number and 
engine number, in the case of all other vehicles,”, and 

in Regulation 17(3) by the substitution of “options concerned, 
vehicle identification number and engine number” for “options 
concerned and the letters and numbers of the chassis or frame and 
engine”.

title: section 141 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992), hereby make the following
heading: 5. The First Schedule to the Regulations of 1992 is amended –
text_raw:
5. The First Schedule to the Regulations of 1992 is amended – 

in paragraph 2A by the substitution of the following for “Diagram 
No. 3”: 

(a) 

“ 

Diagram No. 3”, 

(b) 

in paragraph 2A by the substitution of the following for “Diagram 
No. 4”: 

“ 

Diagram No. 4”, 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [268] 

(c) 

by inserting the following paragraph after paragraph 2A: 

“2B. The identification mark of an eligible vehicle may be 
displayed on a rectangular plate which shall correspond with 
either Diagram No. 5 or Diagram No. 6 shown below: 

Diagram No. 5 

Diagram No. 6”, 

(d) by inserting the following paragraph after paragraph 12: 

“12A. The green stripe for an eligible vehicle shall be colour 
Pantone 7481c or a colour match that is as close as possible to 
this colour and shall be formed of reflex reflective material.”, 

(e) 

by the substitution of the following for paragraph 14: 

“14. The identification mark shall appear in black characters and 
each letter or figure shall have a height of not less than 65 
millimetres and not more than 70 millimetres. The stroke width 
of each letter or figure shall be not less than 9 millimetres and not 
more than 10 millimetres. The total width of the space taken by 
each letter or figure (other than the letter “I” or the number “1”) 
shall be not less than 33 millimetres and not more than 50 
letters and 
millimetres. The distances between adjoining 
adjoining figures shall be uniform and shall be not less than 8 
millimetres.”, 

(f) 

in paragraph 16 by the substitution of “Diagram No. 1, Diagram 
No. 3 or Diagram No. 5” for “Diagram No. 1”, 

 
 
 
 
 [268] 5 

(g) 

in paragraph 16(b) by the substitution of “a distance of not less 
than 40 millimetres and not more than 45 millimetres from the 
inner edge of the black border on the left-hand side of the plate;” 
for “a distance of 40 millimetres from the inner edge of the black 
border on the left-hand side of the plate;”, 

(h) 

in paragraph 16 by inserting the following subparagraph after 
subparagraph (b): 

“(ba) the green stripe for an eligible vehicle shall extend vertically 
from the inner edge of the black border at the top of the plate to 
the inner edge of the black border at the bottom of the plate and 
shall extend horizontally for a distance of 30 millimetres from the 
inner edge of the black border on the right-hand side of the 
plate;”, 

in paragraph 16(c) by the substitution of “on the right-hand side 
of the plate or the inner edge of the green stripe on the right-hand 
side of the plate” for “on the right-hand side of the plate”, 

in paragraph 17 by the substitution of “Diagram No. 2, Diagram 
No. 4 or Diagram No. 6” for “Diagram No. 2”, 

in paragraph 17(b) by the substitution of “a distance of not less 
than 40 millimetres and not more than 45 millimetres;” for “a 
distance of 40 millimetres;”, 

(i) 

(j) 

(k) 

(l) 

in paragraph 17 by inserting the following subparagraph after 
subparagraph (b): 

“(ba) the green stripe for an eligible vehicle shall extend vertically 
from the lower edge of the blue background of the flag of the 
European Communities to the inner edge of the black border at 
the bottom of the plate and shall extend horizontally for a distance 
of 45 millimetres from the inner edge of the black border on the 
left-hand side of the plate;”, 

(m) 

in paragraph 17(d) by the substitution of “a stroke width of 10 
millimetres” for “a stroke width of 10 millimeters”, 

(n) 

in paragraph 17(e) – 

(i) 

by the substitution of “the left-hand side of the plate or the 
inner edge of the green stripe on the left-hand side of the 
plate” for “the left-hand side of the plate”, 

(ii) by the substitution of “30 millimetres” for “30 millimeters”, 

(o) 

(p) 

in paragraph 18 by the substitution of “motorcycle” for “bicycle”, 

in paragraph 18(b) by the substitution of “Diagram No. 1, 
Diagram No. 2, Diagram No. 3, Diagram No. 4, Diagram No. 5, 
or Diagram No. 6 of this Schedule” for “in Diagram No. 1 or 
Diagram No. 2 in paragraph 2 of this Schedule or in Diagram No. 
3 or Diagram No. 4 in paragraph 2A of this Schedule”, 

(q) 

in paragraph 19 – 

(i) 

by the substitution of “motorcycle” for “bicycle”, 

 6 [268] 

(ii) by the substitution of “Diagram No. 2, Diagram No. 4 or 

Diagram No. 6” for “Diagram No. 2 or Diagram No. 4”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 18 June 2025 

NIALL CODY, 
 Revenue Commissioner 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [268] 7

title: section 141 of the Finance Act 1992 (No. 9 of 1992), hereby make the following
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Vehicle Registration and Taxation Regulations, 
1992 (S.I. No. 318 of 1992) to introduce a green stripe on registration plates for 
vehicles that emit no CO2 tailpipe emissions. 

 
 
 
 
 8 [268]
